title: 109_hr3796
content:
The "AmeriCorps Disaster Relief Corps Act of 2005" authorizes the Corporation for National and Community Service to establish the Special AmeriCorps Disaster Relief Corps. The AmeriCorps Disaster Relief Corps is established to provide humanitarian assistance to disaster victims through service projects. The Corporation aims to recruit up to 10,000 participants for the program, with eligibility criteria similar to other approved programs. The AmeriCorps Disaster Relief Corps recruits participants for humanitarian assistance to disaster victims, with eligibility criteria similar to other approved national service programs. Priority is given to individuals displaced by major disasters, with alternative documentation allowed for eligibility. Participants in the national service program can serve on projects that help disaster victims assess their needs, build temporary housing, provide relocation services, conduct outreach for disaster relief, and offer employment services. The national service program involves assisting disaster victims with job training, placement, environmental surveys, supporting school systems, mentoring students, preparing public officials for future disasters, and aiding in the rebuilding of affected regions. The Corporation may use funds to support AmeriCorps projects, the National Civilian Community Corps, the VISTA program, and cooperate with other Federal agencies. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS.

Defines "emergency" and "major disaster" as per the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act.

SEC. 6. TRANSFER OF FUNDS TO THE NATIONAL SERVICE TRUST.

The Corporation transfers funds to the National Service Trust for educational awards and related assistance.

SEC. 7. AUTHORITY FOR THIRD-TERM BENEFITS AND EDUCATIONAL AWARD. SEC. 7. AUTHORITY FOR THIRD-TERM BENEFITS AND EDUCATIONAL AWARD.

Individuals in this program can serve a third term and receive benefits and educational awards as those in the first or second term. SEC. 10. Grants provided under this Act for national service programs are not subject to annual appropriations limitations. SEC. 11. The Corporation can use funds to support national service programs operated by federal agencies. SEC. 12. $150,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for fiscal years 2006 and 2007 for the Corporation to carry out this Act.
